channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for GA
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for GA

item.title: Report E-2024010241
item.description:
Report E-2024010241

Identified by scraper @ 2024-01-18T15:13:34+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-01-10
  • City: ELLENWOOD
  • State: GA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R&L CARRIERS SHARED SERVICES, L.L.C.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On January 10, 2024, one (1) 5-gallon pail of UN3098 was damaged during shipping and released approximately five (5) gallons of product to the trailer interior and pavement below. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from First Call Environmental (FCE) to remediate the impacted site. FCE personnel collected one (1) damaged 5-gallon pail of UN3098 and containerized it in one (1) 55-gallon drum. Crews then deployed granular absorbents to the impacted area and worked them in using hand tools. FCE personnel utilized absorbent wipes to remediate any residual product. All UN3098 impacted material was collected and containerized in three (3) 55-gallon drums for disposal by R+L.

item.title: Report E-2024010120
item.description:
Report E-2024010120

Identified by scraper @ 2024-01-12T18:13:06+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-01-05
  • City: ATLANTA
  • State: GA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: XPO Logistics terminal NAT experienced a UN1992 Pro Form Lacquer Thinner Fast 19122 release from a 5-gallon metal pail. ERTS dispatched contractors to conduct cleanup operations. Contractors arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 1-gallon of product released to a 2’ x 2’ area of the trailer floor due to a forklift puncture. Upon contractor arrival the released material had dried/evaporated and there was no material to collect with absorbents. The damaged pail was collected into a 55-gallon poly drum. The waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.
